result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Carey Haynes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Carey Haynes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Carey Haynes was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Pepin County Case No. 2016CM24

miscConds.notes: Costs waived based on ability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Carey Haynes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard Carey Haynes in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution of cases:  16CM30 plea to count 1, dismiss count 2; plea to D.C. charge in 16CM24, dismiss 16CM23.  Court advises defendant of charge in 16CM24/max penalties; advised of count 1 in 16CM30/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty to D.C. and Bail Jumping.  Court dismisses Ct 2 in 16CM30 and dismiss 16CM23.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 1 yr. probation with conditions; advised of appeal rights.
Defendant Richard Carey Haynes in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
